feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 4:13PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water In The Noatak, Kobuk And Koyukuk Valleys... The northwest Interior received 2 to 5 inches of rainfall in the past week, with the heaviest amounts in the Upper Kobuk, Upper Noatak, and lower Koyukuk Valleys. Expect rivers in the Noatak, Kobuk and Koyukuk Valleys to remain high this week. Flooding is not expected, but most gravel bars will be covered by
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 4:13PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Tuesday and Wednesday Along The West Coast From the Bering Strait To The Yukon Delta... A strong storm developing in Eastern Russia on Monday will move along the West Coast of Alaska on Tuesday, and into the Interior by Wednesday. This will bring south winds of 25 to 40 mph to the West Coast on Tuesday that will decrease slowly Tue night and Wed.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 28 at 8:13AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA ON MONDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area on Monday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 26 at 9:12AM MST by NWS

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 29 at 12:03AM CDT until August 29 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: The National Weather Service in Midland/Odessa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Mitchell County in western Texas... Scurry County in western Texas... * Until 315 AM CDT. * At 1203 AM CDT, gauge reports indicated thunderstorms producing

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 2:56AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Taylor County through 330 AM CDT... At 255 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rib Lake to near Dorchester. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail and frequent lightning.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 2:48AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lincoln, southwestern Vilas and western Oneida Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 247 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Turtle Flambeau Flowage to near Dorchester. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 28 at 9:46PM CDT until August 29 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...High waves of 3 to 5 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Door, Kewaunee and Manitowoc Counties.
